extension.dc:title: GGBN Amplification Extension
extension.name: Amplification
extension.dc:description: Support for DNA Amplifications as an extension for Material Sample core sample data in Darwin Core. Intended to be a one to many relation to the Material Sample core.

property.name: amplificationDate
property.dc:description: Date when the amplification was carried out

property.name: amplificationStaff
property.dc:description: Person or Institution who performed the amplification

property.name: amplificationSuccess
property.dc:description: true/false or yes/no whether the ampliciation was successful in general; highly recommended to report unsuccessful runs

property.name: amplificationSuccessDetails
property.dc:description: Details about the amplification, e.g. including why it has failed

property.name: amplificationMethod
property.dc:description: Method used for amplification

property.name: primerSequenceForward
property.dc:description: Sequence of forward primer used for this amplification

property.name: primerNameForward
property.dc:description: Name of forward primer used for this amplification

property.name: primerReferenceCitationForward
property.dc:description: First reference of the primer

property.name: primerReferenceLinkForward
property.dc:description: Link to the first reference of the primer

property.name: primerSequenceReverse
property.dc:description: Sequence of reverse primer used for this amplification

property.name: primerNameReverse
property.dc:description: Name of reverse primer used for this amplification

property.name: primerReferenceCitationReverse
property.dc:description: First reference of the primer

property.name: primerReferenceLinkReverse
property.dc:description: Link to the first reference of the primer

property.name: purificationMethod
property.dc:description: Method or protocol used to purify the PCR product

property.name: consensusSequence
property.dc:description: Consensus sequence derived from all individual sequences

property.name: consensusSequenceLength
property.dc:description: Length of the consensus sequence (number of base pairs)

property.name: consensusSequenceChromatogramFileURI
property.dc:description: Link to the chromatogram of the consensus sequence

property.name: barcodeSequence
property.dc:description: DNA Barcode sequence (part or 100% of the consensus sequence)

property.name: haplotype
property.dc:description: Name of the haplotype, if applicable

property.name: marker
property.dc:description: Genetic locus/marker or DNA fragment amplified by PCR

property.name: markerSubfragment
property.dc:description: Name of subfragment of a gene or locus. Important to e.g. identify special regions on marker genes

property.name: geneticAccessionNumber
property.dc:description: Definite number or ID under which the DNA sequence is deposited in a public database (GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ accession number)

property.name: BOLDProcessID
property.dc:description: Definite number or ID under which the DNA sequence is deposited in the BOLD database

property.name: geneticAccessionURI
property.dc:description: URI of the related record in a public database (GenBank/DDBJ/EMBL record).

property.name: GC-content
property.dc:description: guanine-cytosine content in mol %

property.name: chimera_check
property.dc:description: A chimeric sequence, or chimera for short, is a sequence comprised of two or more phylogenetically distinct parent sequences. Chimeras are usually PCR artifacts thought to occur when a prematurely terminated amplicon reanneals to a foreign DNA strand and is copied to completion in the following PCR cycles. The point at which the chimeric sequence changes from one parent to the next is called the breakpoint or conversion point

property.name: assembly
property.dc:description: How was the assembly done (e.g. with a text based assembler like phrap or a flowgram assembler etc). Input: CV

property.name: sop
property.dc:description: Relevant standard operating procedures

property.name: finishing_strategy
property.dc:description: Was the genome project intended to produce a complete or draft genome, Coverage, the fold coverage of the sequencing expressed as 2x, 3x, 18x etc, and how many contigs were produced for the genome

property.name: annot_source
property.dc:description: For cases where annotation was provided by a community jamboree or model organism database rather than by a specific submitter

property.name: markerAccordance
property.dc:description: Result of comparison of two markers of two specimens or strains. Name or TAX-ID (NCBI) of compared specimens/strain and the relative identity percentage must be given

property.name: seq_quality_check
property.dc:description: Indicate if the sequence has been called by automatic systems (none) or undergone a manual editing procedure (e.g. by inspecting the raw data or chromatograms). Applied only for sequences that are not submitted to SRA or DRA e.g. none or manually edited

property.name: adapters
property.dc:description: Adapters provide priming sequences for both amplification and sequencing of the sample-library fragments. Both adapters should be reported; in uppercase letters

property.name: mid
property.dc:description: Molecular barcodes, called Multiplex Identifiers (MIDs), that are used to specifically tag unique samples in a sequencing run. Sequence should be reported in uppercase letters
